page.title: 11Transport
page.content: Seamer lies about 4 miles from Scarborough and buses run frequently between the two.The buses stop 4 times in Seamer village.The journey itself takes about 12 minutes and costs 48p for an adult and half that for a child.Fares go up often so the number of Seamer people using the Seamer services has dropped in the last 10 years.Approximately 500 passengers use Seamer station per week.The trains used to be diesle units but now are main line coaches hauled by locomotives.In the summer 84 trains pass through Seamer per week and in winter 60 per week.Their main destinations are York,Liverpool,Hull, Holyhead and Manchester and returning, to Scarborough.The speed of the trains between Scarborough and Seamer is 60mph and between Seamer and York 70mph.
